Html:
Hi Guys,

Trying to add maps to my compact framework v3.5 app and am having trouble compiling the program. I get the following error:

Error 1 The type 'System.Windows.Forms.UserControl' is defined in an assembly that is not referenced. You must add a reference to assembly 'System.Windows.Forms, Version=2.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=b77a5c561934e089'.

Is there any way around this? I am referencing system.windows.forms but i think its v3.5. I assumed that they would be backwards compatible? I am a bit of a noob with the compact framework.
you added wrong dll, use windows mobile version: GMap.NET.WindowsForms.dll, it's in VS2008 solution GMap.NET.sln

Thanks, I have fixed that issue.

I want to be able to just plot Lat/Long coordinates and not the actual map. Is this possible? Can I have just a white background?

Thanks,

I have another question regarding loading times. The map control takes quite a while to load on my mobile device. Is there anyway I can optimise this process or is there a specific procedure I should follow to load the control?
it loads fast, you are doing something wrong
